Class Tank

  • java.lang.Object
    • Tank

  • public class Tank
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double[] bottomLeft 
      (package private) boolean coordsSet 
      private double[] topRight 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tank()
      Sole constructor that creates a tank defined by two arrays that act as coordinates for two corners of the tank in a 3D space.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tank

        public Tank()
        Sole constructor that creates a tank defined by two arrays that act as coordinates for two corners of the tank in a 3D space. The arrays are ordered as such:

    • Method Detail

      • setCoordinates

        public void setCoordinates(double[] bL,
                  double[] tR)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Defines the locations of the bottom left and top right corners of the tank to give location and dimensions to the space. The coordinates must be only 3 points each.
        Parameters:
        bL - The bottom left corner's set of coordinates
        tR - The top right corner's set of coordinates
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the coordinates are not three points

      • getBottom

        public double getBottom()
        Returns:
        the double value of the height of the bottom of the tank from the ground

      • getTop

        public double getTop()
        Returns:
        the double value of the height of the top of the tank from the ground

      • baseArea

        public double baseArea()
        Calculates the area of the base of a tank by subtracting two pairs of points and multiplying them together
        Returns:
        the area of the base

      • getHeight

        public double getHeight()
        Finds the height of a tank by taking the difference between the top and bottom
        Returns:
        Height of a tank

      • getVolume

        public double getVolume()
        Finds the volume of a tank by taking the height of the tank multiplied by the base area
        Returns:
        Volume of a tank

      • coordHasPosLength

        private boolean coordHasPosLength(double[] bL,
                        double[] tR)
        Checks to see if a pair of 3d coordinates have positive length
        Parameters:
        bL - Bottom left coordinates
        tR - Top right coordinates
        Returns:
        True if positive, false if negative

      • checkValidCoords

        private boolean checkValidCoords(double[] bL,
                       double[] tR)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Checks to see if the given coordinates are valid
        Parameters:
        bL - Bottom left coordinate
        tR - Top right coordinate
        Returns:
        True if valid coordinates, false if not
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the coordinates are not valid
